CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 13, 1962, pg. 7, reads: "Observance Founders - Local citizens who were instrumental in founding the George Washington Carver national Commemorative Association, Inc., under the leadership of Mrs. Alma Illery, are shown before the luncheon honoring the renowned scientist. Left to right: The Rev. B.S. Mason, Mrs. Mason, Spurgeon Illery, Mrs. Illery, F. Gardner Gillen, 1962 chairman of Carver week; Dr. Dorothy Evans, chairman for the luncheon; Dr. Mary K. Marshall, Mrs. J.C. Hairston, luncheon co-chairman, and Dr. Hairston. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait from left: Rev. and Mrs. B. S. Mason, Spurgeon Illery, Alma Illery, F. Gardner Gillen, Dr. Dorothy Evans, Dr. Mary K. Marshall, and Mrs. and Dr. J. C. Hairston, in Webster Hall for Eighteenth Annual Washington Carver luncheon
